title: Blunt Chest Trauma - Rib Fractures

options.text: Administer supplemental oxygen and manage pain if possible

title: Facial Trauma - Mandible Fracture

title: Burn Trauma - Thermal Burns
pcr_text: 22-year-old female with burns to arms and chest from house fire. Approximately 25% BSA burned, partial and full thickness. Patient in pain. BP 115/70, HR 120, RR 24, SpO2 95%.
correct_error: Major thermal burns. Stop burning process and cover wounds per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Stop burning process and cover with clean sheets

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Ice can worsen burns. Clean covering is appropriate per 2022 Standards.

title: Multiple Trauma - MVC
pcr_text: 55-year-old male ejected from vehicle in rollover MVC. Patient has head laceration, chest pain, abdominal tenderness, and deformed left leg. BP 95/60, HR 125, RR 26, SpO2 93%.

options.text: Assess and support ABCs, then transport immediately

options.feedback: INCORRECT! ABCs take priority over other assessments. Systematic approach per 2022 Standards.

title: Pelvic Trauma - Unstable

title: Eye Trauma - Penetrating

title: Chemical Burn - Acid
pcr_text: 35-year-old female with sulfuric acid spill on arms and chest. Skin white and leathery. Patient in severe pain. BP 125/80, HR 115, RR 22, SpO2 97%.

title: Hypothermia - Severe
pcr_text: 65-year-old male found outside in winter, unresponsive with core temperature 89°F. Patient rigid with slow breathing. BP 85/50, HR 35, RR 8, SpO2 90%.

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Aggressive rewarming can cause complications. Gentle handling per 2022 Standards.

title: Heat Stroke
pcr_text: 38-year-old male working outdoors, confused and combative. Skin hot and dry, core temperature 105°F. BP 130/85, HR 140, RR 30, SpO2 97%.

options.text: Remove clothing and apply cooling measures
Give patient ice water to drink
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Oral intake may cause vomiting. External cooling preferred per 2022 Standards.
